org.jsfml.window

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
      • org.jsfml.window.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WindowStyle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RenderWindow

    public class Window
extends SFMLNativeObject
implements WindowStyle
    A basic window that provides an OpenGL context.

    This class implements the WindowStyle interface for quick access to the constants provided by it.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.jsfml.window.WindowStyle

        CLOSE, DEFAULT, FULLSCREEN, NONE, RESIZE, TITLEBAR

      • isLegalWindowThread

        public static boolean isLegalWindowThread()
        Checks whether the current native thread is eligibile for creating a window.

        This will always be the case on Windows or Linux, but on Mac OS X, it will check whether the JVM was started in the main thread using the -XstartOnFirstThread command line parameter.

        Returns:
        true if the current native thread may create a window, false otherwise.

      • create

        public void create(VideoMode mode,
          String title,
          int style,
          ContextSettings settings)
        Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened.
        Parameters:
        mode - the video mode that determines the window's size. This must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set.
        title - the window title.
        style - the style of the window. This should be a combination (using OR of the style flags WindowStyle.TITLEBAR, WindowStyle.RESIZE, WindowStyle.CLOSE and WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN, or WindowStyle.NONE for no style. WindowStyle.DEFAULT provides a default combination of style flags.
        settings - the context settings for the created OpenGL context.
        See Also:
        VideoMode.isValid(), WindowStyle, ContextSettings

      • create

        public final void create(VideoMode mode,
          String title,
          int style)
        Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened. The default context settings will be used for the OpenGL context.
        Parameters:
        mode - the video mode that determines the window's size. This must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set.
        title - the window title.
        style - the style of the window. This should be a combination (using OR of the style flags WindowStyle.TITLEBAR, WindowStyle.RESIZE, WindowStyle.CLOSE and WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN, or WindowStyle.NONE for no style. WindowStyle.DEFAULT provides a default combination of style flags.
        See Also:
        VideoMode.isValid(), WindowStyle

      • create

        public final void create(VideoMode mode,
          String title)
        Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened. The WindowStyle.DEFAULT window style will be applied and default context settings will be used for the OpenGL context.
        Parameters:
        mode - the video mode that determines the window's size.
        title - the window title.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the window and destroys all attached resources, including the OpenGL context provided by it.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Checks if the window has been created and is opened.

        Note that the open state is not directly affected by the user clicking the window's close button, if available. In order to accomplish that, listen to an event of type Event.Type.CLOSED and use the close() method.

        Returns:
        true if the window has been created and is currently open.

        public Vector2i getPosition()

        the absolute position of the window's top left corner on the screen.

      • getSettings

        public ContextSettings getSettings()
        Retrieves the context settings for the window's OpenGL context.

      • pollEvent

        public Event pollEvent()
        Pops the event on top of the event stack, if any, and returns it.

        This method needs to be called regularly in order to process pending events. If this is not done, the window will be unresponsive.

        Returns:
        the event currently on top of the event stack, or null if there is none.
        See Also:
        waitEvent()

      • waitEvent

        public Event waitEvent()
        Pops the event on top of the event stack and returns it, or, if there is none, waits until an event occurs and then returns it.

        This method will block the program flow until an event is returned.

        Returns:
        the event currently on top of the event stack, or the next event that will occur.
        See Also:
        pollEvent()

      • pollEvents

        public Iterable<Event> pollEvents()
        Returns an Iterable that consecutively calls pollEvent() and can be used to process all pending events.
        Returns:
        an Iterable over all pending events.
        See Also:
        pollEvent()

      • setVerticalSyncEnabled

        public void setVerticalSyncEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables vertical synchronization (VSync).

        Activating vertical synchronization will limit the number of frames displayed to the refresh rate of the monitor. This can avoid some visual artifacts, and limit the framerate to a good value (but not constant across different computers).

        This should not be used in combination with setFramerateLimit(int), as these two will conflict with one another.

        By default, vertical synchronization is disabled.

        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable vertical synchronization, false to disable.

      • setMouseCursorVisible

        public void setMouseCursorVisible(boolean show)
        Determines whether the mouse cursor, if moved over the window, is visible or not.
        Parameters:
        show - true to make the cursor visible, false to hide it.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(String title)
        Sets the window's title.
        Parameters:
        title - the window's new title.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean show)
        Shows or hides the window.
        Parameters:
        show - true to show the window, false to hide it.

      • setKeyRepeatEnabled

        public void setKeyRepeatEnabled(boolean enable)
        Determines whether automatic key repeat is enabled.

        If enabled, multiple key press events will be fired when a key stays pressed (much like in a text field).

        Key repeat is enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable, false to disabled.

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(Image icon)
        Sets the icon of the window.
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon image.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
               throws ContextActivationException
        Activates or deactivates the window as the current OpenGL rendering target.

        If a window gets activated, all other windows operating in the same thread will automatically be deactivated.

        Parameters:
        active - true to activate, false to deactivate.
        Throws:
        ContextActivationException - in case window activation fails.

      • setActive

        public final void setActive()
                     throws ContextActivationException
        Activates the window as the current OpenGL rendering target.

        If a window gets activated, all other windows operating in the same thread will automatically be deactivated.

        Throws:
        ContextActivationException - in case window activation fails.

      • display

        public void display()
        Flushes the OpenGL pixel buffer to the screen.

        This should be called every frame after everything has been drawn in order to make the changes visible in the window.

      • setFramerateLimit

        public void setFramerateLimit(int flimit)
        Sets the maximum frame rate in frames per second.

        If a limit is set, the display() method will block for a short delay time after flushing the buffer in order to possibly maintain a constant frame rate.

        This should not be used in combination with setVerticalSyncEnabled(boolean) } as these two will conflict with one another.

        By default, there is no frame rate limit.

        Parameters:
        flimit - the maximum frame rate in frames per second, or 0 to disable the frame rate limit.

      • setJoystickTreshold

        public void setJoystickTreshold(float treshold)
        Sets the joystick treshold.

        Joystick axis movements with a magnitude smaller than this treshold will not fire a joystick event.

        The default joystick treshold is 0.1.

        Parameters:
        treshold - the joystick treshold, ranging between 0 and 100.
        See Also:
        JoystickMoveEvent
